intro: Amoria tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly amoria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Amoria tomentosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitats.
